item.title: 欧洲的城市困境：从变暖的未来拯救过去
item.description: 每一位来到维也纳的游客都会被带到米凯勒广场（Michaelerplatz），这是位于奥地利首都中心的一个圆形鹅卵石广场。在中世纪教堂、巴洛克式建筑和现代主义的卢斯豪斯（Looshaus）建筑的映衬下，这里的标志性建筑每年都会吸引数十万人前来参观。【原文：Every tourist in Vienna is at some point directed to Michaelerplatz, a circular cobblestone plaza in the heart of the Austrian capital. Framed by a medieval church, baroque buildings and the modernist Looshaus, the site’s iconic architecture attracts hundreds of thousands of people a year.】

item.title: 布鲁塞尔将推迟柴油限制，以应对绿色议程的反弹
item.description: 布鲁塞尔推迟了在欧盟首都禁止大量柴油车的计划，因为气候措施遭到了更广泛的反弹。【原文：Brussels delayed a plan to ban a wide swath of diesel cars from the capital of the European Union amid a wider backlash against climate measures.】

item.title: 最高法院维持美国环保局甲烷排放规则不变
item.description: 美国最高法院暂时拒绝停止拜登政府对油井、油罐和输油管道排放的会导致地球变暖的甲烷的打击。【原文：The US Supreme Court refused for now to halt a Biden administration crackdown on planet-warming methane emissions from oil wells, tanks and pipelines.】

item.title: 马士基希望船舶监管机构在 2025 年批准全球二氧化碳征税
item.description: 航运业巨头 A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S 预计，该行业的全球监管机构将于明年批准对船舶的温室气体排放收费。【原文：Shipping giant A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S expects the industry’s global regulator next year to approve a charge on vessels’ greenhouse gas emissions.】

item.title: 即将到来的全球水资源保卫战
item.description:
世界上有一半人口面临缺水问题，《汉娜-弗莱与未来》 探讨如何利用技术扭转这一日益严峻的螺旋式上升趋势。【原文：

With half of the world’s population facing water scarcity, The Future with Hannah Fry explores how technology may be used to reverse an increasingly dire spiral.

】

item.title: 欧洲央行警告银行在气候风险管理方面将面临更多罚款
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）警告企业，如果不充分应对未来的风险，将面临更多罚款，从而加大力度让贷款人做好应对气候变化影响的准备。【原文：The European Central Bank has stepped up its efforts to prepare lenders for the fallout from climate change by warning firms they face even more fines if they don’t sufficiently address the risks ahead.】

item.title: 电动汽车充电将升级为机场贵宾室：绿色日报
item.description: 今天的时事通讯探讨了为什么未来的电动汽车充电站不一定会像现在看到的大多数充电站一样。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享本篇报道的完整版。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at why the EV charging station of the future won’t necessarily look like the majority you see now. You can read and share a full version of this story on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 德国、法国和意大利敦促欧盟放松银行业监管
item.description: 德国、法国和意大利敦促欧盟在制定金融规则时表现出克制，转而专注于提高其银行业的竞争力，这是全球政治转向经济增长优先于监管的最新迹象。【原文：Germany, France and Italy urged the European Union to show restraint in financial rule making and instead focus on boosting the competitiveness of its banking sector, the latest sign of a global political shift to prioritize economic growth over regulation.】

item.title: 美国洪水保险计划正在进行更多的重复赔付
item.description:
随着气候变化引发极端降雨，已有超过 40,000 处房产获得了多次高昂的洪水保险赔付，而 2000 年仅有 10,000 处。【原文：

As climate change spurs extreme rain, more than 40,000 properties have received multiple costly flood insurance payouts — up from 10,000 in 2000.

】

item.title: 捷克人希望为陷入困境的欧盟汽车制造商制定更宽松的绿色目标
item.description: 捷克政府支持软化欧洲汽车制造商脱碳目标的呼吁，因为他们正在努力应对电动汽车需求下降和来自中国的竞争加剧。【原文：The Czech government backed calls to soften decarbonization targets for European carmakers as they grapple with a drop in demand for electric vehicles and intensifying competition from China.】

item.title: 巴西遭遇史上最严重干旱，全球粮食价格面临飙升风险
item.description:
长期无降雨正在成为常态，世界的 "面包篮子 "是气候变化如何颠覆生活和整个经济的一个缩影。【原文：

Long periods without rainfall are becoming the norm — and the world’s bread basket is a microcosm of how climate change is turning lives and whole economies upside down.

】

item.title: 中国太阳能机械公司向印度提供大宗订单
item.description: 中国林顿科技集团是世界上最大的太阳能硅片制造设备制造商之一，该公司称已获得一家印度企业的设备订单，可为一座 10 千兆瓦的太阳能发电厂生产足够的组件。【原文：China’s Linton Technologies Group, one of the world’s largest makers of machinery to build solar wafers, said it secured an order from an Indian business for equipment to produce enough of the components for a 10-gigawatts solar power plant.】

item.title: 私人市场成为能源转型投注的主要力量
item.description: 根据 BloombergNEF 的研究，私人市场正在成为能源转型投资的主要力量，而规模大得多的公共市场则更容易接受化石燃料投资。【原文：Private markets are emerging as a major force in energy-transition investing, while the much larger public markets are more receptive to fossil-fuel holdings, according to research from BloombergNEF.】

item.title: 为什么极端降雨越来越频繁，越来越致命？
item.description: 最近几周，暴雨引发洪水和山体滑坡，造成非洲、欧洲、亚洲和美国部分地区数百人死亡，数百万人流离失所。【原文：Torrential rains that triggered floods and landslides have killed hundreds of people and displaced millions across parts of Africa, Europe, Asia and the US in recent weeks.】

item.title: 西班牙太阳能供应过剩可能会抑制一些新项目的实施
item.description: 据极光能源研究有限公司（Aurora Energy Research Ltd.）称，今年西班牙太阳能发电供过于求，将价格压得很低，一些项目可能因盈利能力下降而无法建设。【原文：An oversupply of solar power in Spain has pushed prices so low this year that some projects may not be built due to a drop in profitability, according to Aurora Energy Research Ltd.】

item.title: 日本公司联合起来减少液化天然气供应中的甲烷排放
item.description: 22 家日本公用事业公司和贸易公司正在加入一项倡议，旨在利用它们的购买力来遏制液化天然气供应链中的甲烷排放，因为全球遏制这种有害温室气体的压力正在增加。【原文：Twenty-two Japanese utilities and trading houses are joining an initiative that aims to leverage their buying power to curb methane emissions from liquefied natural gas supply chains, as pressure mounts globally to curb the harmful greenhouse gas.】

item.title: 非洲开发银行考虑参股更多非洲信贷担保企业
item.description: 非洲开发银行计划再投资两家信用担保公司，以促进非洲大陆与气候和可持续性相关项目的融资。【原文：The African Development Bank plans to invest in two more credit guarantee companies to boost financing for climate-related and sustainability linked projects on the continent.】

item.title: 新西兰达尼丁市一天降下一个月的雨量，洪水泛滥
item.description: 新西兰达尼丁市宣布进入紧急状态，因为该市气象部门警告说，一天之内可能降下一个多月的雨量。【原文：A state of emergency has been declared in the New Zealand city of Dunedin as the nation’s meteorological service warns that more than a month’s rain could fall in a day.】

item.title: 2023 年和 2024 年南极洲冬季海冰比以往任何时候都少
item.description:
今年的海冰最大值是有记录以来的第二低值 ，也是去年的最低值 ，这表明了气候变化的影响。【原文：

The sea ice maximum was the second lowest on record this year and the lowest last year, pointing to the influence of climate change. 

】

item.title: 饱受海伦娜暴雨侵袭的佛罗里达州面临新威胁：降雨量高达一英尺
item.description: 在飓风海伦（Helene）猛烈登陆一周后，佛罗里达州正准备迎接大西洋酝酿中的热带系统带来的新一轮强降雨和强风。【原文：One week after Hurricane Helene barreled ashore, Florida is bracing for another round of heavy rainfall and strong winds from a tropical system brewing in the Atlantic.】

item.title: 杜克大学不顾气候目标延长最大煤电厂寿命
item.description: 杜克能源公司（Duke Energy Corp. ）计划推迟其最大燃煤发电厂的退役时间，将其在 2035 年前关闭所有燃烧这种肮脏燃料的发电厂的气候目标搁置一边。【原文：Duke Energy Corp. plans to delay the retirement of its largest coal-fired power plant, pushing aside its climate goal to shutter all plants that burn the dirty fuel by 2035.】

item.title: 指环王》导演向渡渡鸟灭绝初创公司投资1000万美元
item.description: 电影导演彼得-杰克逊（Peter Jackson）和他的伴侣、制片人弗兰-沃尔什（Fran Walsh）是最新一批支持生物灭绝初创企业巨像生物科学公司（Colossal Biosciences Inc.这对夫妇向这家以试图让从渡渡鸟到长毛象等动物复活而闻名的公司投资了 1000 万美元。【原文：Film director Peter Jackson and his partner, producer Fran Walsh, are the latest wealthy celebrities to throw support behind de-extinction startup Colossal Biosciences Inc. The couple invested $10 million in the company known for trying to bring back animals from the dodo to the woolly mammoth.】

item.title: 欧洲的森林保护运动如何陷入困境
item.description: 欧盟决心成为应对气候变化的全球领导者。该集团在 2022 年末做出了迄今为止最激进的举措，决定禁止进口在世界上任何地方新近砍伐森林的土地上生产的产品。【原文：The European Union is determined to be a global leader in the fight against climate change. In its most radical move yet, the bloc decided in late 2022 to ban the import of products made on recently deforested land, anywhere in the world.】

item.title: 气候引发的风暴和火灾让美国无处幸免
item.description:
在过去的五年中，价值数十亿美元的天气灾害波及美国的每个角落。【原文：

Billion-dollar weather disasters have touched every corner of the US in the past five years.

】

item.title: 丛林覆盖的苏里南有望启动 500 亿美元的碳市场
item.description: 作为哥伦比亚大学的一名研究生，凯文-康拉德提出了一个减少全球碳排放的激进计划：向贫穷国家支付保护森林的费用，以此作为全球应对气候变化的一部分。【原文：As a graduate student at Columbia University, Kevin Conrad came up with a radical plan to reduce global carbon emissions: Pay poor nations to preserve their forests as part of the global fight against climate change.】

item.title: 新太阳能将满足欧洲冬季大部分电力需求增长
item.description: 目前，欧洲太阳能发电能力的增长非常强劲，即使在冬季，该技术也能满足大部分电力需求的增长。【原文：The increase in European solar capacity is now so strong that even during the winter the technology will satisfy most of the growth in electricity demand.】

item.title: 现实打击了欧洲的绿色雄心
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将探讨欧盟是如何因世界各国和企业抱怨其过度追求环保而被迫刹车的。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享全文。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at how the European Union has been forced to hit the brakes on its green ambitions as countries and businesses around the world have complained it has overreached. You can read and share the full story on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 有抱负的伦敦 "泥腿子 "挤爆新许可证网站
item.description:
由于需求量过大，在泰晤士河沿岸搜寻 2000 年前遗物的许可申请已关闭近两年。【原文：

Applications for permits to comb the River Thames foreshore for relics of the past 2,000 years had been closed for almost two years due to overwhelming demand.

】

item.title: 欧盟南部国家呼吁对能源暴利征税
item.description: 希腊、罗马尼亚和保加利亚希望对低成本能源生产商的暴利征税，以应对他们所说的欧盟电力价格脱钩问题。【原文：Greece, Romania and Bulgaria want to tax the windfall profits made by low-cost energy producers to combat what they say is a decoupling of power prices in the European Union.】

item.title: 墨西哥领导人大胆的清洁能源计划被视为 "空想
item.description: 墨西哥新任领导人提出了一项雄心勃勃的计划，旨在提高该国的可再生能源产量，该计划面临着严峻的政治和技术挑战，耗资可能高达 500 亿美元。【原文：An ambitious plan by Mexico’s new leader to boost the nation’s renewable energy production faces steep political and technical challenges, and could cost up to $50 billion.】
